page.title: 03ROSSINGTON PIT, SHIFT WORK
page.content:
Four different shifts are worked at Rossington they are as follows- "Days" - 06.00 to 13.15 hours "Afters" - 12.00 to 19.15 hours "Evenings"- 19.00 to 23.15 hours "Nights" - 23.00 to 06.15 hours
Jim Neil and George Walker tell us about how the shifts system works - "When we arrive at work we go to the time keeper and collect 2 brass checks, these have our numbers on, one check is for going down the other for coming out. We change into overalls and boots, we then go to the Lamp Cabin to collect a safety lamp ,safety helmet and a self rescuer. Safety helmets are used to test for dangerous gases and self rescuers must be carried at all times in case of emergency, fire or roof collapse. All men wear cap lamps."
